abstract: This just in from the Dept. of Unintended Consequences: among the many, many pieces of e-mail I received about my column about Google’s day-care woes last week were several from parents who had children in other day-care centers in Silicon Valley, particularly the small handful that use the Reggio Emilia philosophy. Apparently, when Google was preparing to open its ultra-fancy center, The Woods, it aggressively recruited Reggio Emilia-trained day-care teachers from all over the Bay Area. It lured them with much higher salaries and the prospect of being full-fledged Google employees — status that more than a few Google engineers can’t claim.
lead_paragraph: This just in from the Dept. of Unintended Consequences: among the many, many pieces of e-mail I received about my column about Google’s day-care woes last week were several from parents who had children in other day-care centers in Silicon Valley, particularly the small handful that use the Reggio Emilia philosophy. Apparently, when Google was preparing to open its ultra-fancy center, The Woods, it aggressively recruited Reggio Emilia-trained day-care teachers from all over the Bay Area. It lured them with much higher salaries and the prospect of being full-fledged Google employees — status that more than a few Google engineers can’t claim.

headline.main: More on Google and Day Care

abstract: Google Chief Executive Eric Schmidt is quickly establishing itself as one of the most press-friendly attendees at Sun Valley’s annual gathering of high-powered media and technology types. Last year, he spent a solid hour answering reporters’ questions in a late-night rap session.
lead_paragraph: Google Chief Executive Eric Schmidt is quickly establishing itself as one of the most press-friendly attendees at Sun Valley’s annual gathering of high-powered media and technology types. Last year, he spent a solid hour answering reporters’ questions in a late-night rap session.

headline.main: Sun Valley Diary: Google on Yahoo, YouTube

abstract: Google and Viacom are still wrangling over how much to shield identifying information about individual users in YouTube data that Viacom wants in a copyright dispute.
snippet: Google and Viacom are still wrangling over how much to shield identifying information about individual users in YouTube data that Viacom wants in a copyright dispute.
lead_paragraph: UPDATED| 7:25 p.m. Comment from Viacom added.

headline.main: Viacom and Google in Stalemate Over Shielding Identities in YouTube Data
